Title.evidence: Randomised Controlled Trial of Circumferential Patellar Cauterization in Bilateral TKA

Participants.evidence: 78 patients (156 knees) undergoing bilateral, simultaneous TKA without patellar resurfacing were included

Intervention.evidence: with patellar cauterization performed on the right knee

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy of circumferential patellar cauterization in reducing anterior knee pain and improving functional outcomes

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the Kujala score for anterior knee pain, assessed preoperatively and at 1 month and 2 years postoperatively

Result_Outcome.evidence: no significant difference was found in the Kujala score between cauterized and non-cauterized knees (mean difference 0.3; 95% CI, -0.599 to 1.202; p = 0.509)

Harms.evidence: Complication rates were similar, with one deep venous thromboembolism in the cauterized group and two in the control group

Trial_Registration.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided

Funding.evidence: Trial registration and funding details were not provided
